meanings.definition: To speak in a quick, confused, and unclear way.
meanings.sent1: She spluttered her words nervously during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The old radio spluttered out a garbled message.
meanings.sent3: As the teacher asked her a question, she spluttered out a mix of answers.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to explain the complex topic only spluttered out incoherent phrases.
meanings.sent5: The engine spluttered to life after a few failed attempts.

meanings.definition: To make a series of short explosive spitting or choking sounds.
meanings.sent1: The frying pan spluttered as she added the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The campfire spluttered and crackled in the quiet night.
meanings.sent3: The soda can spluttered when he opened it, spraying a mist of bubbles.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks spluttered before bursting into a colorful display.
meanings.sent5: The rain spluttered against the window, creating a soothing rhythm.
